text: Flamingos do not bend their knees backward. What appears to be a knee is actually their ankle joint.
A day on Venus is longer than a year (243 vs. 225 Earth days).
Humans glow faintly in the dark, but the light emitted is 1,000x weaker than what our eyes can detect.
Cleopatra lived closer to the invention of the iPhone than to the building of the Great Pyramid.
Octopuses can rapidly edit their RNA in response to temperature changes, with some changes occurring within hours.
Saturn has 274 known moons, with Titan being the largest.
The intestine regenerates its lining, known as the epithelium, every 5 to 7 days.
The first computer bug was a literal moth stuck in a 1947 Harvard machine.
Plants have memory, which allows them to retain information from their experiences and respond to environmental stimuli later..
The Moon is slowly drifting away from Earth at 3.8 cm (1.5 inches) per year.
The aorta, your largest artery, is as wide as a garden hose.
Ancient Romans used fermented human urine as a cleaning agent to remove grease stains from clothing.
Dolphins develop a unique signature whistle early in life, allowing them to be identified by other dolphins.
Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon would weigh 6 billion tons.
The human brain is composed of approximately 75% water, making hydration crucial for optimal cognitive function.
The first webcam was invented to monitor a coffee pot at Cambridge University.
An elephant's trunk is a complex network of 40,000 muscles, compared to just 600 in the entire human body.
Pluto has a heart-shaped glacier known as Sputnik Planitia.
You produce about 1 to 1.5 liters of saliva daily.
In the 17th century condoms were often made from animal intestines, such as those of sheep, calves, or goats.
Polar bears have black skin to absorb sunlight under their white fur.
The Sun's core temperature reaches around 15 million °C (27 million °F), where nuclear fusion occurs
The human brain is nearly 60% fat, which makes essential fatty acids crucial for brain health.
The word 'robot' comes from the Czech word 'robota', which means 'forced labor'.
The immortal jellyfish can revert to its juvenile form, effectively resetting its lifespan.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a vast anticyclonic storm that has been raging for at least 150 years.
The cornea is the only part of the human body that lacks a blood supply—it gets oxygen from the air.
The first photograph was taken in 1826 and required 8 hours of exposure.
Blue whales possess the largest heart of any living creature, weighing approximately 900kg.
Mars has the tallest volcano in the solar system — Olympus Mons, rising about 22 km (14 miles) high.
Your tongue print is unique, like a fingerprint.
The microwave was invented by accident after an engineer noticed a magnetron tube melted a candy bar in his pocket.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
The coldest known place in the universe is the Boomerang Nebula, which has a temperature of about −272°C (-458°F).
Your taste buds regenerate every 10 to 14 days.
A tree absorbs anywhere between 10 and 40kg of CO2 per year.
Crows can remember human faces and hold grudges for up to 17 years.
On the Moon, you would weigh approximately 16.5% of your weight on Earth due to its lower gravity.
Atoms never truly stop moving, even at absolute zero—they just reach their lowest quantum vibrations.
The tiny bumps on the F and J keyboard keys help touch-typists locate the home position.
A shrimp's heart is located in its head.
The Milky Way galaxy is about 100,000 light-years wide.
Helium is the only element that cannot be solidified at standard pressure.
At least half of the oxygen produced on Earth comes from the ocean, mostly from tiny photosynthesizing plankton.
Sloths can hold their breath underwater for as long as 40 minutes.
Venus rotates clockwise, which is opposite to most planets.
Fire tornadoes can reach temperatures of up to 1,090°C (2,000°F).
The reason golf balls have dimples is because they help the ball fly farther by reducing air resistance.
Koalas have fingerprints nearly identical to humans.
The first human-made object in space was Germany's V-2 rocket in 1944.
Petrichor is the smell of rain when it falls on dry ground.
The little pocket inside jeans was originally designed for pocket watches in the 1800s.
Baby porcupines are called porcupettes.
The Hubble Space Telescope orbits Earth at 17,000 mph (27,300 km/h).
Lava is not nearly hot enough to melt a diamond.
The male seahorse gives birth, not the female.
Moonquakes are seismic events that occur on the Moon, similar to earthquakes on Earth.
If you hold a solid piece of pure gallium metal in your hand, your body heat can melt it into its liquid form.
The number 142,857 is cyclic: multiplying it by 1-6 always gives the same digits in the same order.
Despite their long necks, giraffes have the same number of vertebrae as humans: seven.
The largest known star is UY Scuti, a red supergiant star with a radius approximately 909 times that of the Sun.
The shortest possible time interval is the Planck time (5.39 × 10⁻⁴⁴ seconds).
The blue whale's tongue can weigh 2.7 to 3.6 metric tons (6,000 to 8,000 pounds), roughly the weight of a mature elephant.
Light takes 8 minutes 20 seconds to travel from the Sun to Earth.
Diamond is the hardest naturally occurring material on Earth.
Bamboo is the world's fastest-growing plant. Some types can grow a full meter in a single day.
Hippos are the closest living relatives to whales and dolphins.
The Kármán line marks the boundary between Earth's atmosphere and space at 100 kilometers (62 miles) altitude.
Hydrogen makes up roughly 75% of the observable universe.
The snailfish is the deepest recorded fish species, which was filmed at a depth of 8,336 meters (27,349 feet).
The ISS orbits Earth once every 92 min, which allows astronauts to see as many as 16 sunrises and sunsets a day.
The word 'laser' stands for 'Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation'.
The tiger pistol shrimp generates a powerful shockwave by rapidly snapping its large claw.
The first photo of Earth from space was taken in 1946 by a V-2 rocket.
The smallest possible black hole could be as small as an atom but have the mass of a large mountain.
It takes about 12 worker bees their entire lives to produce a single teaspoon of honey.
Uranus' extreme axial tilt causes the planet to rotate on its side, producing unique seasons.
The smell of metal is actually the scent of your skin corroding the metal.
The mimic octopus can impersonate over 15 different sea creatures to deter predators.
The Moon's surface is covered in a layer of dust called regolith.
The oldest known DNA ever found on earth dates back approximately 2 million years.
Monotremes are the only group of living mammals that reproduce by laying eggs.
Voyager 1 is the most distant human-made object, located over 25 billion km (~15 billion miles) from Earth
Any month that starts on a Sunday contains a Friday the 13th.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
The word 'astronaut' comes from the Greek astron ('star') and nautēs ('sailor'), literally meaning 'star sailor.'
The fastest land animal is the cheetah, which can go from 0 to 100 km/h (0 to 60 mph) in just 3 seconds.
Hyperion, the tallest tree on Earth, towers over the Statue of Liberty by 21 meters.
Famously slow-moving, a sloth travels at an average speed of 0.24 km/h (0.15 mph)
The bee hummingbird is the smallest living bird and produces eggs as small as coffee beans.
The electric eel can generate shocks up to 600 volts.
Bone marrow is the fastest-growing tissue, producing billions of new blood cells every day.
The whale shark is the largest fish in the world, which has been known to get as large as 18 meters (60 feet)
Bats are the only mammals capable of true, sustained flight.
Ants can carry 10 to 50 times their body weight due to their high ratio of muscle tissue to body mass.
Antarctica is the only continent without reptiles or snakes.
The peregrine falcon is the fastest animal, capable of reaching diving speeds over 320 km/h (200 mph)
The only bird that can fly backward is the hummingbird.
The lyrebird can mimic chainsaws, car alarms, and camera shutters.
Lake Vostok is the largest known subglacial lake in Antarctica.
